member.name: T:PCSC.Iso7816.ClaHighPart
member.summary: Coding and meaning of the class byte

member.name: F:PCSC.Iso7816.ClaHighPart.Iso0x
member.summary: The structure and coding of command and response are as described in ISO/IEC 7816. 'x' contains the options for secure messaging and the logical channel.

member.name: F:PCSC.Iso7816.ClaHighPart.Iso8x
member.summary: The structure of command and response are as described in ISO/IEC 7816. 'x' contains the options for secure messaging and the logical channel. The coding (and meaning) of command and response are proprietary.

member.name: F:PCSC.Iso7816.ClaHighPart.Iso9x
member.summary: The structure of command and response are as described in ISO/IEC 7816. 'x' contains the options for secure messaging and the logical channel. The coding (and meaning) of command and response are proprietary.

member.name: F:PCSC.Iso7816.ClaHighPart.IsoAx
member.summary: If not specified by the application context, structure and coding of command and response are as described in ISO/IEC 7816. 'x' contains the options for secure messaging and the logical channel.

member.name: F:PCSC.Iso7816.ClaHighPart.IsoBx
member.summary: The structure of command and response are as described in ISO/IEC 7816.

member.name: F:PCSC.Iso7816.ClaHighPart.IsoCx
member.summary: The structure of command and response are as described in ISO/IEC 7816.

member.name: F:PCSC.Iso7816.ClaHighPart.ProprietaryDx
member.summary: The structure of command and response are proprietary.

member.name: F:PCSC.Iso7816.ClaHighPart.ProprietaryEx
member.summary: The structure of command and response are proprietary.

member.name: F:PCSC.Iso7816.ClaHighPart.ProprietaryFx
member.summary: The structure of command and response are proprietary.

member.name: T:PCSC.Iso7816.CommandApdu
member.summary: A Command Application Protocol Data Unit (APDU), defined by the ISO/IEC 7816 standards

remarks.para: A can be build using one of the following :

item.description: CLA INS P1 P2 Lc Data
CLA INS P1 P2 Lc Data Le

remarks.para: See the documentation for for more information.

member.name: M:PCSC.Iso7816.CommandApdu.#ctor(PCSC.Iso7816.IsoCase,PCSC.SCardProtocol)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:PCSC.Iso7816.CommandApdu.CLA
member.summary: Gets or sets the CLA byte.
member.remarks: You can use the class to build a well formed CLA byte.

member.name: P:PCSC.Iso7816.CommandApdu.P1P2
member.summary: A combination of parameter P1 and P2

member.name: P:PCSC.Iso7816.CommandApdu.Data
member.summary: Command APDU data to be transmitted.
member.remarks: You can only set data if you created the with ISO case 3 or 4.

member.name: P:PCSC.Iso7816.CommandApdu.Le
member.remarks: This is the expected number of response data bytes. Do not take account of the status word (SW1 and SW2) here!

member.name: M:PCSC.Iso7816.CommandApdu.GetLength
member.summary: Calculates the APDU size in bytes.
member.returns: The APDU size in bytes depending on the currently selected ISO case.

member.summary: Converts the command APDU to a transmittable byte array.
member.returns: The command APDU as byte array.
member.exception: If the command APDU is in an invalid state.

member.summary: Indicates if the command APDU is valid.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the structuring method is a transparent EF.

member.name: P:PCSC.Iso7816.FileStructureInfo.RecordInfo
member.remarks: Returns a instance if the file structuring method is a record EF. Otherwise .

member.name: P:PCSC.Iso7816.FileStructureInfo.IsRecord
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the structuring method is a record EF.
member.value: true if the EF is record; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:PCSC.Iso7816.FileStructureType
member.remarks:
The following structures of elementary files are defined:
Transparent structure; the EF contains a sequence of data units.
Record structure; the EF contains a sequence of individually identifiable records.
When using a record structure, the size of the particular records is either fixed or variable. Furthermore records are organized as a sequence (linear) or as a ring (cyclic).

member.name: F:PCSC.Iso7816.FileStructureType.NoInformation
member.summary: No information about file structure given

member.name: F:PCSC.Iso7816.FileStructureType.Transparent
member.summary: Transparent. The EF has a sequence of data units

member.name: F:PCSC.Iso7816.FileType.Dedicated
member.summary: Dedicated file (DF) that is used for logical organization of data in the card.

member.name: F:PCSC.Iso7816.FileType.Elementary
member.summary: Elementary file (EF) that is used for storing data.
member.remarks: The data may or may not be interpreted/analyzed by the card. You need to check the extended file type .

member.name: T:PCSC.Iso7816.IsoCase
member.summary: APDU message structure for the command-response pair.

item.description: Command: no data, Expected response: no data
Command: no data, Expected response: data
Command: data, Expected response: no data

remarks.para: In the card capabilities, the card states that the Lc and the Le field should either be short or extended. A short command has one byte for each length field, an extended command has two bytes for each length field.

member.name: F:PCSC.Iso7816.IsoCase.Case1
member.summary: No command data. No response data.

member.name: F:PCSC.Iso7816.IsoCase.Case2Short
member.summary: No command data. Expected response data.

member.name: F:PCSC.Iso7816.IsoCase.Case2Extended
member.summary: No command data. Expected response data.

member.name: T:PCSC.Iso7816.RecordInfo
member.remarks:
Elementary files (EF) that have a sequence of individually identifiable records should use one of the following methods for structuring:
Linear elementary file (EF) with records of variable size.
Linear elementary file (EF) with records of fixed size.
Cyclic elementary file (EF) with records of fixed size.

member.name: M:PCSC.Iso7816.RecordInfo.#ctor(System.Byte)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:PCSC.Iso7816.RecordInfo.IsCyclic
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the EF has cyclic records.
member.value: true if the EF is cyclic; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:PCSC.Iso7816.RecordInfo.IsLinear
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the EF has linear records.
member.value: true if the EF is linear; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:PCSC.Iso7816.RecordInfo.IsFixed
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the EF's record size is fixed.
member.value: true if the record's size is fixed; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:PCSC.Iso7816.RecordInfo.IsVariable
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the EF's record size is variable.
member.value: true if the record's size is variable; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:PCSC.Iso7816.RecordInfo.IsSimpleTlv
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the EF contains simple TLV records.
member.value: true if the EF contains simple TLV records; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:PCSC.Iso7816.SW1Code
member.summary: Meaning for the first status word SW1 (ISO7816-4).

member.name: F:PCSC.Iso7816.SW1Code.NormalDataResponse
member.summary: Normal data response. SW2 indicates the number of remaining response bytes.

member.name: F:PCSC.Iso7816.SW1Code.WarningNVDataNotChanged
member.summary: Warning. The state of non-volatile memory has not been changed.
member.remarks:
SW2 could have one of the following values:
SW2Meaning
0x00No information.
0x81Returned data may be corrupted.
0x82End of file or end of record reached. The number of bytes read is less than specified in
0x83The selected file invalidated.
0x84FCI is not correctly formatted.

member.name: F:PCSC.Iso7816.SW1Code.WarningNVDataChanged
member.summary: Warning. The state of non-volatile memory has been changed.
member.remarks:
SW2 could have one of the following values:
SW2Meaning
0x00No information.
0x81File filled up.

member.name: F:PCSC.Iso7816.SW1Code.ErrorNVDataNotChanged
member.summary: An error occurred. The state of non-volatile memory has not been changed.

member.name: F:PCSC.Iso7816.SW1Code.ErrorNVDataChanged
member.summary: An error occurred. The state of non-volatile memory has been changed.
member.remarks:
SW2 could have one of the following values:
SW2Meaning
0x00No information.
0x81Memory failure.

member.name: F:PCSC.Iso7816.SW1Code.ErrorFunctionNotSupported
member.summary: The function defined in CLA is not supported.
member.remarks:
SW2 could have one of the following values:
SW2Meaning
0x00No information.
0x81Logical channel not supported
0x82Secure messaging not supported

member.name: F:PCSC.Iso7816.SW1Code.ErrorCmdNotAllowed
member.remarks:
SW2 could have one of the following values:
SW2Meaning
0x00No information.
0x81The command is not compatible with the file structure.
0x82The security status is not satisfied.
0x83The authentication method is blocked.
0x84The referenced data has been invalidated.
0x85The conditions are not satisfied.
0x86The command is not allowed. No current elementary file (EF).
0x87Expected secure messaging data objects are missing.
0x88Secure messaging data objects are incorrect.

member.name: F:PCSC.Iso7816.SW1Code.ErrorP1P2Incorrect
member.summary: Error wrong parameters P1 and P2
member.remarks:
SW2 could have one of the following values:
SW2Meaning
0x00No information.
0x80The parameters in the data field are incorrect.
0x81The requested function is not supported.
0x82File not found.
0x83Record not found.
0x84The file has not enough free space.
0x85The parameter is inconsistent with the TLV structure.
0x86The parameters and are incorrect.
0x87 is not consistent with .
0x88The referenced data was not found.

member.name: F:PCSC.Iso7816.SW1Code.ErrorParameterIncorrect
member.summary: Error wrong parameters P1 and P2

member.name: F:PCSC.Iso7816.SW1Code.ErrorInsNotSupported
member.summary: The instruction code is invalid or not supported.

member.name: F:PCSC.Iso7816.TlvDataType.BasicEncodingRules
member.summary: ASN.1 (abstract syntax notation) structured using basic encoding rules defined in ISO/IEC8825.
